lines.text: Where do I come in?
You don't come in. You go out.
Go out, where?
To Hollywood. As my personal representative. I want you to get out there and take charge. Tell that lunatic Von Stroheim he finishes the picture in ten days, or else you pull the plugs.
Excuse me, sir, do you know Universal Studios?
The funny farm? Yeah, who doesn't!
Tell Mr. Laemmle only Von Stroheim decides to fade away Von Stroheim picture. Not some stupid, ignorant, pathetic, imbecile errant boy.
[turns to his crew]
Places now. We begin.
Listen, I'm getting tired of horsing around.
Von Stoheim never horses around.
The day I lose Tony is the day I lose my sense of humor. If I lose that I may as well die.
Who the heck is Prince Massimo?
A real Italian prince Von Stoheim brought in specially.
Von loves his accent.
Loves his accent, but, but, but, but there's no sound! These are silent pictures, send him back!
studio exec one day, gopher the next.
Indy? Where'd you get a name like that, from your dog?
Yeah, as a matter of fact, I did.
Well, I suppose it's as good a name as Ford.
Well, you're named after a dog, I'm named after a car, we should get along fine.
Ladies and gentlemen, I think Mr. Jones misses his woman.
Well then he should get himself a horse.
Talk is cheap in this business, kid.
Yeah, maybe you're right.
Of course I'm right. Couple of years you'll be digging up some Egyptian Pharao's tomb and you won't even be thinking about her.

[laughs]
I've never seen run so fast as when you saw that snake
I hate snakes.
What are you afraid of?
It's a long story.
You don't mind acting with a corpse, do you, Kitty?
What's new?
Do you always write like this?
What do you mean?

[sighs before starting to read his letter]
No one can stop me loving you, Clair, but I'm just not the right man for you. You need someone steady, reliable and smart. Like old Tony. I nearly vomited over my waffles when I read this.
Are you sure you don't want to stay, Indy?

[walking with crutches]
I think I'll stick to archeology. Safer.
